text:
“You know, now that I think of it, I always
wanted to be a baker!”

Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies! Today I have a special
Ro: guest, Dyrus!
Dyrus: Why hello there.

Ro: Thank you for being here, I’m so excited
that he’s here, for those of you who

Ro: don’t know, Dyrus is a pro gamer for
League of Legends. He plays for TSM.
Ro: If you can't read, Team SoloMid, awww. So, do you have any baking experience?

Dyrus: Um, I almost burnt down our gaming
house once… Ro: That’s OK.

Dyrus: When I put it in the microwave for
40 minutes.

Ro: You put a meal in the microwave for 40
minutes?
Dyrus: It was an accident…

Ro: Today we are gonna be making Lulu cupcakes.
I got so many requests for these,

Ro: and I thought, who better to come help
me than dis guy! Yeah!
Dyrus: Yay! Ro: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things you will need, will be: 1 teaspoon
of baking powder, 1/4 a teaspoon

Ro: of salt, 2 cups of all purpose, just regular
flour, 1 cup of butter, which is

Ro: 2 sh-ticks of butter, 1/2 a teaspoon of
vanilla extract, 1-1/2 cups of sugar,

Ro: just regular sugar. 1/4 cup of whole milk
and 1/2 a cup of fresh blueberry

Ro: puree. This puree actually took like 40
minutes, it’s really, really cool, I’ll show you

Ro: guys how to do it, it’s so yummy! It’s
1/2 a cup, that’s all you need.

Dyrus: You will also need 2 eggs, they kind
of look like dinosaur eggs, I’ve never seen

Dyrus: those eggs before, but, those are 2
eggs, and this is apparently called a sifter.

Ro: Yeah a sifter! Dyrus: It looks like a
silver cup. And we need a bowl, well

Dyrus: it’s actually 2 bowls. Ro: Yeah 2
bowls. Dyrus: I didn’t know that.

Dyrus: And then we have the cupcake tray and
these little things, that, uh,

Dyrus: I’ve never, the only thing that I’ve
ever seen in the ingredients are

Dyrus: these because all I’m doing is eating
them.

Ro: A-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha! Yeah, cupcake
liners! They’re really really handy,
Ro; so you can hold the cupcake and om-nom-nom-nom-nom!
Ro: Alright, let’s put it all together!

Ro: To make blueberry puree, you’re gonna
take 1 pound of fresh blueberries,

Ro: and pour them into a medium sized saucepan
and bring them to a boil.

Ro: I like to stir them with a big wooden
spoon so that the berries won’t burn,

Ro: As the berries heat up on the stove they
turn into a liquid form and that’s

Ro: what we want! Once the blueberries begin
to boil, reduce the heat to low and
Ro: then let them simmer for about 40 minutes.

Ro: Now pour the blueberry mixture into a
blender and blend for a few seconds.

Ro: Once blended, pour through a sieve into
a bowl to make smooth strained

Ro: blueberry puree, and measure 1/2 a cup
for the recipe.

Ro: I’m also super excited because I finally,
finally after years of baking,

Ro: finally got a Kitchenaid, so, this is
the first time I’m ever using it,

Ro: but I figured we could figure it out together…
Right? I’ll go get it.
Dyrus: Great… Ro: Hahahaha!
Ro: It’s so heavy!

Ro: The first thing that you want to do is
cream your butter and your sugar.

Ro: So we’ve gotta get these in the bowl,
that’s our goal.

Ro: OK, do you want to try and open that?
Or…

Ro: OH! Dyrus: OK. Ro: Lift it up, alright
we did it!

Ro: This is, we’re off to a good start,
alright. Dyrus: Already leveled up.

Ro: I’ll let you pour in the sugar. Dyrus:
All of it? Ro: All the sugar.

Dyrus: Really? Ro: Just pour it all in. Dyrus:
Wow.

Ro: Then we’re gonna add our butter, and
you gotta unwrap it. This is soft butter

Ro: you want to leave it out to be room
temperature so it’s nice and soft,

Dyrus: Which speed? Ro: You’re just gonna
whip it together until everything is

Ro: light and fluffy and… This speed is
from 2-10, I’m gonna pick, let’s do 6!
Dyrus: OK… Ro: Let’s see what happens!

Ro: You can do it, I have faith, this is gonna
work.

Ro: Whoa-ah-ohhhhh! OK, maybe not 6, maybe
4, 4 is a good one!
Ro: 4…
Ro: Whoa, check that out prefect!

Ro: Our butter and sugar is nice and light
and fluffy, and now we’re gonna
Ro: add eggs, 1 at a time.

Ro: Do yo know how to do a 1 handed egg crack?
Dyrus: No…

Ro: Oh my gosh, OK, I’ll do the first 1, and
then Dyrus is gonna do the second 1.

Ro: So we’re gonna add these 1 at a time, so
this is how you do it, you hold it in

Ro: your hand and you hit and twist. Hit,
twist!

Dyrus: So you hit, and then twist? Ro: Yeah,
hit, crack, and then twist
Ro: with your hand… Hee-hee-hee-hee-hee!

Dyrus: Don’t worry… Ro: If a little bit
of shell falls in it’s OK, we’re gonna
Ro: blend it, no one will be able to notice.

Dyrus: So now that this is mixed, we’ll
start sifting our flower. I still don’t

Dyrus: know what this is, and what sifting
means, but I’m about to find out.

Ro: Yeah, I’m gonna teach you. So, in 1
of your extra bowls, we’re gonna sift

Ro: all of our flour, so hold this over the
bowl, OK, and I’m gonna scoop this

Ro: in there. This is just to make sure everything
is really finely grated,

Ro: there’s no chunks. And then you’re
gonna take this little wheel, and
Ro: spin it around, it’s a little noisy.

Ro: Boom! Now you’re gonna put in your other
dry ingredients like baking powder and salt!

Dyrus: And now that we have our mountain of
powdery looking salt, we are now going

Dyrus: to mix this. Ro: There you go, mix
it all together.

Dyrus: I’m not sure if I’m doing this
right… Ro: That’s good whisking!

Ro: Alright, in our second bowl we are going
to mix together all the wet

Ro: ingredients. We’re gonna start with
our whole milk.
Ro: Mewp!

Ro: Then you’re gonna pour in the blueberry,
fresh blueberry puree. Dyrus: Wow…
Ro: Puree! Pur… Yes!
Ro: Now vanilla extract.

Ro: We’re about to combined our wet and
dry ingredients, so let’s put our
Ro: thinking caps on! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

Ro: This is not Lulu’s bittersweet skin,
that would have been absolutely perfect,

Ro: but I thought this would… It’s Lulu’s
cupcakes right, so this still

Ro: kind of works right? Dyrus: You’ll have
your own special skin.
Ro: Yeah I have my own skin.

Ro: Alright, let’s put these together! First,
let’s start with putting a little bit of wet.
Ro: Here we go, meeeee!

Ro: Alright, then mix it up! Put it on speed
4.

Ro: Then you’re just gonna alternate and
add the dry ingredients, and keep

Ro: going back and forth until all of your
mixtures are gone.

Ro: We’ve got our batter all mixed together,
it’s all evenly combined,

Ro: it smells so good! That looks great! OK,
what you’re gonna do is take a

Ro: tablespoon scoop, this is what I like
to do, and you’re gonna do 2 scoops in

Ro: every cupcake tray. And you can just use
your finger, just wash your hands
Ro: you want it to be 2/3 full.

Ro: Once you got your cupcake trays all filled,
you’re gonna heat your oven
Ro: to 350 and you're gonna bake these for about 18 minutes.
Ro: OK, while our cupcakes are in the oven baking, we’re gonna be makeing a made from scratch

Ro: blackberry buttercream frosting. Dyrus:
Wow. Ro: Yum-yum-yum-yum!

Ro: Because it should be like a light pink color,
that’s what I’m going for.

Ro: So, OK, the first thing that we’re gonna
do is zest our lemon.

Ro: I’m gonna let you do this, it’s kind
of like a cheese grater, you’re gonna
Ro: take the lemon and then kinda grade lightly.

Ro: Yeah nice! That’s looking good! Now,
while he’s doing that, I’m gonna show

Ro: you guys how to make a little bit of blackberry
puree over in the kitchen.

Ro: To make quick blackberry puree you’re
gonna take 8 ounces of fresh blackberries

Ro: and microwave them for 30 seconds, this
will make them warm and soft.

Ro: Then pour them into a sieve with a large
spoon and mash them up and let

Ro: the liquid drain through into the bowl.
Measure out a 1/4 a cup of the
Ro: strained blackberry puree for the recipe.

Ro: So now we got our puree. Dyrus: And we
got a little bit of lemon zest here,

Dyrus: with a little bit of Ro’s right thumb,
a very rare ingredient found

Dyrus: across the lands. I do not recommend
putting a little bit of Ro’s
Dyrus: right thumb into the lemon zest.
Ro: First blood!

Ro: Yeah, whoopsies! Oh well, cheers! We got
all of our ingredients, and now

Ro: we’re gonna beat together 1 cup of butter
in a mixing bowl.

Ro: Once your butter is whipped together,
we’re gonna add the lemon zest.

Ro: Go for it! And blackberry puree. Merp,
for color!

Ro: Last but not least, you’re gonna take
5 cups of powdered sugar, and gradually

Ro: add them to our mixture as we mix. Alright,
let’s get started. You start
Ro: mixing, and I’ll add. Dyrus: OK. Ro: OK.
Dyrus: Oh my gosh, oh my gosh!

Ro: Boom! Our frosting is all done, we’re
just gonna take this and put it in

Ro: a plastic bag with a big tip, and now,
it’s time to decorate!
Dyrus: Yay! Ro: Yay!

Ro: Our cupcakes are fresh out of the oven,
yum, yum, yum! They’ve cooled

Ro: a little bit so they’re ready to decorate.
We are gonna decorate these

Ro: things. I’m gonna teach you how to frost
a cupcake. Dyrus: Wonderful…

Ro: The tip I’m using on the bag is 807,
it’s just a big, round, smooth tip.

Ro: OK, so this is the technique, are you
ready? Dyrus: Yeah.

Ro: OK, I’m training you right now, we’re
gonna start on the outside, and you

Ro: just squeeze gently, and you go all the
way around, kind of outlining the

Ro: cupcake. Dyrus: Wow. Ro: And then you come
in, roooooooo, boom!
Dyrus: It looks like a real cupcake.

Ro: If it looks funny, it’s fine, because
when Lulu turns people into cupcakes they

Ro: look terrified, so, uh, anything you do
is gonna look great.

Ro: Nice. Right on! Look at that! Dyrus: Not
bad if I say so myself!

Ro: That is not bad, his first cupcake that
he ever frosted. Look at that.

Ro: Now to make the little eyes, I got this
little pack of flat eyeballs from

Ro: Wilton, this was just at the grocery store,
but instead of using the big

Ro: eyeball side we’re gonna flip them over
and put them on the cupcake with

Ro: The white side showing. Because in the
game they have little eyeballs like this.

Ro: Little eyeballs, so we’re gonna draw
it on with a little bit of black frosting.

Ro: Ta-da, let’s see these little faces,
we’re gonna turn them around.

Ro: A-ha-ha-ha-ha! Dyrus: A little bit of
this guy wanted a piece of the other guy,

Dyrus: so they kind of, uh… Ro: Here I’ll
help ya.

Ro: OK, so we’re gonna take a little bit
of sprinkles, these are just multicolored

Ro: rainbow sprinkles, and we’re just gonna
take a little pinch, and sprinkle
Ro: a few in the back.

Ro: Are you ready for the last and final step
to decorate?

Dyrus: Yeah… Ro: We’re almost there! We’re
gonna add the cherry on the top,
Ro: these candy red maraschino cherries.

Ro: So you can pick whichever one you’d
like, I just picked a few out

Ro: so they’re ready and easy, and we’re
just gonna stick it right in the middle!
Ro: And just push it down, boop, boop, boop!
Ro: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are our Lulu cupcakes, they’re
so good! Thanks for the suggestions you

Ro: guys, I loved making these, oooooh! Thank
you Dyrus for being here, I had so

Ro: much fun! Did you like it? Your first
baking experience?

Dyrus: Yes it was wonderful, I didn’t burn
down the house or anything like that,

Dyrus: so it was definitely a big upgrade
and… It was fun. Ro: You did good!

Dyrus: Yeah it was great. Ro: He was safer than
I was today, I’m the one that hurt

Ro: myself. Do you have a favorite cupcake
that you made?

Ro: I think my favorite is this guy, I like
this guy.

Dyrus: These 2. Ro: 1 of these guys? Oh man,
I think it’s this, this is my favorite.
Ro: He makes me giggle!

Ro: Again, I’ll put all of Dyrus’ links
down below so you can go check him out.

Ro: The new season of League starts around
January, so I’ll be watching some

Ro: E-Sports. And, if you have any other suggestions
for any other Nerdy Nummies,

Ro: please let me know, leave a comment down
below and I will do my best

Ro: to make it happen. OK, thanks you guys,
bye-bye!
